pageProps.content:
Experience

Deep within Zimbabwe’s flagship Hwange National Park, lies The Hide Safari Camp.
This luxury safari camp with beautiful, tented suites overlooks a busy waterhole with photographic hide - after which the camp has been named. Here guests can get exceptionally close to the various animals coming down to drink.
Hwange National Park offers superb year-round game viewing with frequent sightings of lion, elephant & white rhino as well as a wide variety of antelope. Excellent birding can also be expected.

Stay

Remote & romantic, there are only 7 deluxe tents (including 2 deluxe family tents), each with a private viewing deck with views over the waterhole, luxurious en-suite bathroom & lounge as well as a glass wood-burning fireplace for chilly winter evenings.
There is also a 3-bedroom family tent called Tom’s Little Hide that is best suited for 6 adults & up to 4 children. Tom’s Little Hide comes with a private guide & vehicle.
The central area at The Hide Safari Camp includes a swimming pool, bar & dining room.

Activities

Morning & afternoon game drives & guided bush walks as well as exciting night drives are offered to The Hide’s guests.
The park is famous for its large herds of elephants & buffaloes as well as frequent sightings of African wild dog. Numerous other classic African animals such as giraffe & zebra are easily seen in Hwange & over 400 species of bird species have been recorded.

subfolders.title: Davison's Camp
subfolders.description: Davison’s Camp is a traditional tented safari camp that lies in the Linkwasha Concession in the world-renowned Hwange National Park. The camp overlooks a prolific waterhole that is visible from the main area & all the tents.  Guests can sit on their private deck while watching elephants drink or play in the water.

subfolders.title: Little Makalolo
subfolders.description: Little Makalolo is a luxury tented safari camp with a firm focus on wildlife that lies in Zimbabwe’s flagship Hwange National Park. The camp is discreetly tucked away in a teak forest & overlooks a waterhole that sees a regular procession of animals coming down to drink.

subfolders.title: Somalisa Acacia
subfolders.description: Somalisa Acacia is a stylish, stilted tented safari camp that lies in Zimbabwe’s flagship Hwange National Park & overlooks a busy waterhole. The camp is built along the Kennedy vlei line, which means guests can expect plenty of wildlife action on game drives.
